subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
[[oracle bone script|Oracle bone script]]: {{Han compound|宀|皿|丂|ls=ic|t1=house|t2=food or wine vessel|t3=table (?)}} – contentment. The {{zh-l|*心|heart}} component was added in [[金文|bronze inscriptions]] to yield {{lang|zh|寧}}, and the {{lang|zh|丂}} component was sometimes omitted to yield {{zh-l|*寍}}.

''{{w|Shuowen}}'': {{Han compound|寍|丂|ls=psc|c1=p|c2=s|t2=speech (?)}}.

Note that the simplified form {{zh-l|宁}} is also a traditional character on its own.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[peaceful]]; [[tranquil]]; [[serene]]; [[at peace]]
# [[quiet]]; [[still]]; [[silent]]
# [[stable]]; [[settled]]; [[pacified]]
# {{†}} to [[stabilise]]; to [[pacify]]
# {{†}} to [[settle down]]
# {{†}} to [[mourn]]
# {{†}} {{lb|zh|especially of married women}} to [[visit]] one's [[parent]]s
# {{†}} [[repose]]; [[serenity]]; [[peace]]
# {{zh-alt-name|江寧|old name for [[Nanjing]]}}
# {{zh-alt-name|寧夏|[[Ningxia]]}}

subSections.title: Pronunciation 3
Usage notes
subSections.text: * Not to be confused with the surname {{zh-l|甯|Nìng}}, which was previously also simplified to {{zh-l|*宁}}.
